dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVE (10), pensive and sincere, looks out the window and smiles as the bus he's riding in roars into a DARK TUNNEL

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Want to see some magic? Dave's best/only friend OSCAR looks up from his Game Boy.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Close your eyes.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: (through absurd braces) You're not gonna kish me, are you? Dave shoots him a look. Oscar sighs, closes his eyes. So does Dave and so does -- BECKY (10), a brunette beauty sitting just in front of th The coolest girl in class, she hardly knows Dave exists. KA-CHUNG! The bus hits a grate -- Dave's cue. He counts under his breath, knows the precise number until:

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: .--okay...and...open your eyes! Dave and Becky open their eyes at the exact instant that dark tunnel gives way to the majestic, gleaming spires of NEW YORK CITY -- The most magical city in the world!

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: (back to his Game Boy) Thatsh shome pretty lame magic.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I thought it was cool. Dave looks up to see Becky smiling at him. Dave smiles nervously back, then grins at a stunned Oscar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK CUTS -- Dave's class takes in the sights: THE CHRYSLER BUILDING -- To Dave, those steel gargoyle EA seem ready to take flight...THE STATUE OF ATLAS, massivel heroic in Rockefeller Center...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becky stands in silhouette in front of Chagall's "Aleko a Zemphira by Moonlight." A boy and girl levitate together the nighttime sky -- a child's dream brought to magical l A second silhouette steps into frame: Dave.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: I love the way they float up like that. I come here a lot with my parents. I like all of the paintings, but I love this one the most... Dave looks at her, falling truly, madly, deeply in love - and feeling the sudden urge to tell her.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Becky... Becky turns to look at him. Dave trails off, too scared t tell.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: +..never mind. The rest of the class floods into the room. As Becky join her FRIENDS, Dave knows he blew it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave's class gathers around their teacher, MS. ALGAR, in of the famed WASHINGTON SQUARE ARCH.

dialogues.speaker: MS. ALGAR
dialogues.text: -..this park served as a burial ground in the early 1800's. To this day over 20,000 bodies rest beneath Washington Square... A creeped-out Dave stares at his feet as Ms. Algar points a desolate-looking ELM TREE.

dialogues.speaker: MS. ALGAR
dialogues.text: +-.and this is Hangman's Elm, at 300 years, the oldest tree in Manhattan. Traitors were hanged here during the Revolutionary War... A CREAKING in the withered branches. Just the wind. MOMENTS LATER -- Dave watches Becky from afar.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: How do I tell her how amazing she is...?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Playah, everybody knowsh that. Buy her shomething exshpensive. Dave digs his money out of his pockets. Three bucks. Make that TWO BUCKS as a sudden GUST OF WIND blows a DOLL BILL out of his hand! The bill hits the ground. Dave leans over to grab it when BIKE MESSENGER runs over it. The bill sticks to the tire.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Hey, stop! The bike keeps going. Dave runs after the bike, out onto Third Street, where the bill falls off the tire... And gets snatched up by a FRENCH POODLE!

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Ma'am, your dog! Stop!! But the JOGGING WOMAN can't hear over her headphones. Dave chases the dog down a brick lane lined with eclectic shops. The dog spits out the bill and keeps going. Dave pulls up, breathing hard. He leans over to pick up t bill, then straightens up to find himself looking at -- THE RING... ++san unusual ring on display in a shop window. The band silver, an ancient design; the "gem" is a gray stone that been carved into a long, intricate DRAGON. Dave notices the shop's sign: "ARCANA CABANA - ANTIQUITIE OBSCURITIES, UNUSUAL GIFTS - BALTHAZAR BLAKE, PROPRIETOR. The street has gone eerily quiet. Dave feels an urge to g back the way he came, but drawn by the promise of "Unusua Gifts," he walks into the store, going past -- THE CAR -- parked at the curb, a gleaming monster in blac and chrome: The 1930 BENTLEY SPEED 6 CORSICA...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. ARCANA CABANA -— CONTINUOUS Turns out "unusual" is an understatement. The shop is nar but deep, and packed with all manner of strange objects: An EGYPTIAN MUMMY CASE...weird EXPRESSIONISTIC PAINTINGS. CALIGARI-ESQUE FURNITURE...a yellow-eyed STUFFED OWL that casts weird, animated shadows on the wall... Dave FEELS SOMEONE WATCHING HIM, whirls around to see -- A_MACABRE URN. Two feet tall, it looks hand-painted by Hieronymus Bosch: TORMENTED SOULS and terrifying MONSTER writhe in agony in a nightmare landscape... Dave is about to touch the urn's ornate lid when -- A HAND snatches his wrist! Dave GASPS, looks up to see... BALTHAZAR BLAKE (40) knows how to make an entrance. Tall grim, eyes ringed in black, he wears a long black coat ad with cryptic ALCHEMICAL SYMBOLS. A goth-rock Lord Byron.. And as Byron himself was once described, Balthazar gives impression of being "mad, bad and dangerous to know."

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: (off the urn) You break that one and we both buy it. (releases Dave's hand) Looking for something in particular?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: (freaked) Just a gift...for someone special. Balthazar cocks an eyebrow. He steps behind a display cas and picks up a blood-colored, heart-shaped GLASS JAR.

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: This jar held the hearts of Antony and Cleopatra for a thousand years...until they turned to dust. Dave smiles awkwardly, unsure how to respond.

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: What, a jar stuffed with the disembodied hearts of history's greatest lovers not romantic enough for you? Gee, I'm sorry, I'm fresh out of promise rings!

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: It's not that. It's just... (nervous; deflecting) Hey, that's a cool ring! BALTHAZAR'S RING -- is indeed cool, and very unusual: a luminous GREEN DIAMOND set in an intricate Gothic setting Is it a trick of the light or does the ring fleetingly GL

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: The way it catches the light...

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: (knowingly) Yeah...look at that. Balthazar looks up, stares intently at Dave, appraising h

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: I do have another ring... Balthazar goes to the front window and grabs the unusual DRAGON RING we saw earlier. He holds out the ring to Dave

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: Go ahead...try it on. Dave stares at the ring, feels its strange pull...then se Balthazar standing over him, staring like a madman. Dave gasps, steps back -- right into a GLASS CISTERN that CRASHES to the floor! Water and glass go flying. Dave loo up in horror as Balthazar advances.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Was -- was that valuable?

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: The last drops of water from the Lost City of Atlantis? Gee, what do you think, Dave?!

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: How'd you know my name is --

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: Show me your hands. Dave stammers, confused.

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: Show me your hands!

Dave panics, shuts his eyes and holds out his hands, fear the worst. He feels something, opens his eyes to see... A WOODEN MOP -- lies across his hands. Balthazar heads fo the stairs at the back of the shop.

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: I want the floor shined, the shelves dusted and the windows spotless. The cobwebs stay. Dave bolts for the door but the DEADBOLT has been locked a key. He BANGS on the door in vain. ON THE STAIRS -- Balthazar drops a KEY in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: I'll be in my study.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: You can't keep me here! My class will be looking for me! The door to Balthazar's study SLAMS SHUT.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Please let them be looking for me. Dave looks around the shop, tries hard to breathe. He is screwed. MOMENTS LATER -~ Dave mops the floor, keeping an eye on e shadow and dark corner, of which there are many. He sees some OLD PHOTOS taped to the wall behind a displa case. He leans the mop against a shelf and walks over to display. The DRAGON RING sits at the end of the case as D leans in to see -- THE PHOTOGRAPHS -- are of a raven-haired YOUNG WOMAN, all and mysterious. The last photo shows the woman standing i this very shop, joined by an OLD MAN. . Suddenly Dave looks down at the case, sees -- THE RING -- is in a different place. Closer to Dave.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Weren't you just over there? Dave stares at the ring, simultaneously repelled and attracted to it. He looks both ways, then picks up the ri AN ENGRAVING is etched along the gleaming band:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Take me up..." Dave turns the ring over. On the other side it says:

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: "Cast me away..." The ring is sitting in the palm of his hand when -- THE DRAGON'S CLAWS AND TAIL -- coil and tighten around hi finger! Dave SHOUTS with surprise, grows frantic as he pu harder and harder -- THE RING IS HAPPY WHERE IT Is.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Come on! Come on!!! Dave shakes his hand violently, then looks over to see -- THE MOP -- is moving back and forth in perfect sync! Dave GASPS, freezes. The mop stops bolt upright. Dave moves his hand to the left. The mop SWISHES across t floor to the left. He moves his hand to the right -- agai THE MOP FOLLOWS. The world as Dave knows it has just changed. He's barely begun to process this when -- A SUDDEN KNOCKING SOUND -- spins him around. Persistent a getting louder, it's coming from the back of the shop... A MAHOGANY BOX -- sits on an antique table. The box looks ancient, as does the PADLOCK that secures its lid. THE KNOCKING is coming from inside the box. Dave stares a the box, wary but somehow enthralled. As he lifts his han touch the box -- KLINNK! The padlock POPS OPEN. Eyes wide with wonder, Dav opens the box... A STRANGE NESTING DOLL -- sits inside. What appears to be SORCERER of some kind is painted on the outermost doll, i style that evokes a medieval stained glass. Creepy... +.-and entrancing. Dave picks up the doll, curious what t next doll must look like. He doesn't notice as -- THE EYES -- on the DRAGON RING begin to glow.

Dave turns the top of the doll, which SNAPS into place. T he pulls the top from the bottom and -- VOOOSSHHH!!! A TONGUE OF CRIMSON FLAME explodes out of th doll and up to the ceiling. A FIGURE levitates in the bilious smoke. And as the smoke clears...

dialogues.speaker: DARK FIGURE
dialogues.text: Finally, finally... MAXIM HORVATH (40) floats there, an evil sorcerer of the deadliest rank, and a crazy-eyed motherf**ker.

dialogues.speaker: MAXIM HORVATH
dialogues.text: «..FREEDOM, BABY!!! Dave SCREAMS, music to Horvath's ears. The eyes on his SK RING begin to GLOW RED, when suddenly -- WHOOM!!! A SPHERE of highly-ionized, electro-magnetically compressed matter -- what a physicist would recognize as PLASMA, the fourth state of matter -- SLAMS into Horvath sends him flying. ‘As we'll learn, we've just seen what Stephen Hawking wou call a PLASMOID -- and Balthazar Blake, a PLASMA BOLT. Dave turns to see Balthazar on the stairs, his hands spla out, his RING glowing.

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: Bad news? You just freed Maxim Horvath, one of the deadliest - sorcerers in history... Dave stares in shock as Balthazar vaults the rail and gra large, ancient tome off the shelf -- THE ENCANTUS.

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: Good news? Only a sorcerer could open that doll. In other words -- Balthazar hands the book to Dave, who buckles under its weight. Balthazar grins.

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: -- I just found my new apprentice. Dave stares in horror, unable to imagine worse news than

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: (off the Encantus) Your homework. Learn it.  9. WHAM!!! AN INVISIBLE FORCE ripples through the air, knock Balthazar into the wall, cratering it. A CONCUSSION BLAST

dialogues.speaker: MAXIM HORVATH
dialogues.text: Sorry, Blake. Kid's taking an incomplete on this one. Horvath comes at Dave, who drops the book. Suddenly Horva eyes light up -- the NESTING DOLL lies in his path. [AN E CHINESE SORCERER is depicted on the next outermost doll.] Horvath sees it. Balthazar sees him see it. ’

dialogues.speaker: MAXIM HORVATH
dialogues.text: The Grimhold! Balthazar and Horvath leap through the air. Balthazar get there first, spins out of the way as Horvath SMASHES into display. Balthazar hands the doll to a terrified Dave.

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: Whatever you do, keep this safe...NOW GET OUT OF HERE!!! A FAST AND FURIOUS BRAWL erupts in the shop -- and Dave i caught in the middle! As he ducks for cover we catch FLEE GLIMPSES of PLASMA BOLTS and ANTIQUES large and small fly across the room. Dave is panicked.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: This isn't happening... Dave blindly, reflexively throws his RING HAND out --

dialogues.speaker: GO AWAY
dialogues.text: THOOM! A SPHERE OF LIGHT rocks the shop, sends Dave flyin into the wall. When Dave finally opens his eyes, he's standing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave GASPS, drops the NESTING DOLL to the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: MS. ALGAR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Young man, where have you been?! Dave turns to see Ms. Algar and his class standing there. looks back at the shop, trembling. Ms. Algar decides to h a look, but as she heads for the door --

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Nott! Dave nearly tackles her. He is SCREAMING, out-of-his-mind scared, unsettling the class but especially Becky.

dialogues.speaker: MS. ALGAR
dialogues.text: Dave, what's the matter with you?!

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: You don't know what's in there!!! Ms. Algar brushes him aside, grabs the doorknob and pulls open, TO REVEAL -- The shop is still and silent and exactly as Dave found it Dave can't believe it. His classmates look at him as if h were nuts. Suddenly he sees something on a shelf -- THE LIDDED URN -- that Balthazar warned him about, now wi two new souls depicted on its painted hellscape -- BALTHA AND HORVATH. Dave gasps, turns and runs. As Becky and the others watch him take off down the street... THE NESTING DOLL -- is snatched up by a HOMELESS MAN, who smiles as he tucks it in his ratty coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POLICE SIRENS echo as Dave huddles against a wall, pulls the ring as hard as he can -- IT COMES OFF! Dave runs, tosses the ring in a DUMPSTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Dave runs up the steps to his modest Brooklyn house... - Dave splashes water on his face, looks at himself in th mirror -- THE RING IS ON HIS FINGER. - Dave stands on a train platform, drops the ring in fron an ONCOMING TRAIN... - Dave opens his school locker. THE RING is there. - In the school basement, Dave throws the ring into a hug FURNACE, sees the ring MELT into a small silver puddle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave sleeps fitfully, opens his eyes to see -- THE RING -- is lying on his pillow, whole again. The DRAG EYES glow like tiny embers in the dark. Dave stares at the ring with fear and foreboding, as we —

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave sleeps with a pillow over his head. ARCADE FIRE'S "W UP" suddenly blares on the alarm as Dave groggily tosses pillow aside, TO REVEAL -- 20-YEAR OLD DAVE. He sighs, hits the alarm. . Another day QUICK CUTS -- Dave throws on a faded t-shirt, black hoodi Chuck Taylors. Tall and gawky, on further review he's actually inconspicuously handsome. ON HIS WALLS -- NIKOLA TESLA and ALBERT EINSTEIN take the place alongside GOLDFRAPP, THE RACONTEURS, BUDDY HOLLY. Dave opens a drawer to grab his watch. THE RING is there, but Dave stopped noticing it long ago. He exits without i INT. DAVE'S APARTMENT - KITCHEN ~— CONTINUOUS Dave cradles the phone as he: fishes a chunk of pop-tart a glass of strawberry Quik.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Of course I'm eating healthy, Mom. He glances at the T.V., reaches for his umbrella. A MASSI STORM FRONT is converging on New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave scribbles PHYSICS EQUATIONS in a notebook, his backp sitting on his lap. The car has few RIDERS. A STREET THUG -- suddenly appears in the aisle, lifts his shirt to reveal the butt of a GUN gleaming in his waistba

dialogues.speaker: STREET THUG
dialogues.text: All right, listen up! Gimme your cash and you won't get hurt!  12. The thug moves up the aisle, grabbing cash from shaken RI The ELDERLY LADY next to Dave is terrified. So is Dave.

dialogues.speaker: STREET THUG
dialogues.text: Gimme the ring, grandma! The elderly lady gives up her wedding ring as Dave digs i pockets, pulls out a few bills -- AND THE DRAGON RING. Hi surprise lasts about a half-second.

dialogues.speaker: STREET THUG
dialogues.text: Hand it over! Dave looks up, sees the thug eyeing his ring.

dialogues.speaker: . DAVE
dialogues.text: Oh, believe me, you don't want to --

dialogues.speaker: STREET THUG
dialogues.text: You tryin' to be a hero?! Dave hands the ring over.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Me?! No way! EXT. SUBWAY PLATFORM -— CONTINUOUS The doors open and the thug takes off down the platform. BACK AT THE DOORS -- Dave, the elderly lady and the other riders step off the train to watch the fleeing thug.

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY LADY
dialogues.text: Fifty-two years I had that ring. Now it's gone forever.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Oh...you never know. The elderly lady shoots him a puzzled look. FURTHER DOWN THE PLATFORM -- The thug has almost made it the stairs when -- WHOOM! The thug is jerked up into the air and backward, a if an invisible chain has reached its length, then he is SLAMMED onto the platform on his back. DAVE'S RING -- flies out of the thug's hand. WE ROLL WITH THE RING, all the way down the platform, until it finally comes to a stop.....  13. Right between Dave's feet. He picks up the ring, sighs as drops it in his pocket. The elderly lady's ring has lande nearby. Dave picks it up and hands it to her.

dialogues.speaker: . DAVE
dialogues.text: You have a wonderful day. The elderly lady stares in shock as Dave walks off and he up the stairs toward --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's POURING on 4th Street: THUNDER, LIGHTNING, the works STUDENTS run for cover as Dave opens his umbrella and hea for the SCIENCE BUILDING. He's about to go inside when ~~ A GORGEOUS GIRL (20) comes running out, getting drenched. She runs under Dave's umbrella, catching him off guard.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Whoa! The girl LAUGHS. Dark hair, vintage Kinks t-shirt, plaid mini over black tights, it takes Dave all of one second t realize -- IT'S BECKY.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm going to the communications building. Dave walks right past the science building door.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: No way. Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: KEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Dave, where are you going? Dave turns around to see his classmate KEN CHIN (21). Dav smiles nervously.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Lab starts in like, five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Uhh -- what are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? Hellman wants our proofs by Tuesday. Our entire grade's on the line.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Sorry, I'm going to the communications building. I've got -- communications. Dave glares at Ken, scoots Becky on ahead. Becky looks at him more closely now.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Dave...Dave...wait a minute, we went to grade school together. You're that Dave.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: (nods weakly) Becky, right?

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: You transferred after fourth grade. You were the kid, that whole --

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Arcana Cabana.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: -- Arcana Cabana thing, right. Boy, that was weird. Dave nods at the understatement of the century.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Little bit. It was a little weird.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Wow, I haven't seen you in years.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Actually, we saw each other in high school, at parties and stuff. (off her blank look) You were mingling, you prob'ly don't remember --

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: No, no, I do...oh, hey, this is me. They're in front of the COMMUNICATIONS BUILDING, a side d marked "RADIO STATION PERSONNEL." Dave smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: You work at the radio station? That's awesome, I always wanted to check it out up there.
Awkward beat. Dave is smiling but not moving.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: You...wanna come up?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: (like it's her idea) Really? INT. CITY IMPOUND — DAY Lightning flashes outside the dirty windows, illuminating CITY HALL across the street. We're in a dingy room where seen-it-all AUCTIONEER faces an eclectic mix of BIDDERS.

dialogues.speaker: AUCTIONEER
dialogues.text: Okay, folks, next up...this junk. THE ARTIFACTS FROM BALTHAZAR'S SHOP -- are arrayed on lon tables on either side of the podium.

dialogues.speaker: AUCTIONEER
dialogues.text: These items were impounded by the city and the statutory holding period has now expired. And so, without further ado, Item One, this...thing. A CITY EMPLOYEE hoists an EXPRESSIONISTIC URN -- The one Balthazar warned Dave not to touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE AUDIENCE -- An eccentric-looking RICH WOMAN leans to her BORED HUSBAND.

dialogues.speaker: RICH WOMAN
dialogues.text: That would make a lovely planter for the foyer. The husband rolls his eyes, buries his head in the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becky and Dave sit in the small, dark D.J. BOOTH of WNYU, walls covered with eclectic album covers from JOHN COLTRA GNARLS BARKLEY to RADIOHEAD. Becky has headphones, speaks into a mic:

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: -..off the U.K. version of their L.P. "Bridging the Gap," here's Black Eyed Peas with "Magic."
Becky drops the needle on a VINYL L.P. and flips off her Dave smiles as the MUSIC BEGINS, a funky, unexpectedly romantic reworking of "Every Little Thing She Does is Mag

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I can't believe you're Dr. Vinyl. I listen to you all the time... Dave trails off as he sees Becky with her eyes closed, listening in a state of near rapture. Dave looks on, fall in love with her all over again... Becky opens her eyes, watches the L.P. spinning, smiles a walls of music that surround her.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: If somebody told me I had an hour left to live, this is how I'd want to spend it, right here. Suddenly the MUSIC GOES DEAD and the LIGHTS GO OUT.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Only I'd pay the power bill. The lights flicker, come back on. Still no audio. Becky's producer, the too-cool ANDRE (24), pokes his head in.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRE
dialogues.text: Something's up with the antenna and the engineer's out sick. Becky slumps in her chair. Doing this show is her world.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Where's he keep his equipment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The narrow room is packed to the ceiling with transmitter panels, circuit boards, etc. Becky looks on as Dave plugs handheld SPECTRUM ANALYZER into an antenna port. Andre is just outside, looking on with a tinge of jealous

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Your return-loss is too high, prob'ly because of a lightning strike. Not a direct hit, 'cause you're still transmitting, but close enough to mess up your signal.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: How do you know this stuff?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I'm a physics major. I'm doing a project on transducers.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Uhh, no hablo physics.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry. It's a device that converts one form of energy into another. It's what an antenna does. It takes electrical energy from your transmitter and converts it into electromagnetic energy in the form of radio waves. (smiles) Am I geeking you out?

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: (nods) Little bit. Dave goes to the TRANSMITTER DECK, starts adjusting knobs

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: We just have to re-tune the transmitter...increase your gain just a bit... MUSIC fills the room, the entire studio. Becky smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Let's just get you a cape and a big "D" on your shirt.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRE
dialogues.text: Yeah, for "dork." Becky starts to laugh, catches herself. She glares at And as Dave smiles tightly. So much for his superhero moment.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: So, Dave, I should prob'ly get back to the show.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure, absolutely... Dave watches Becky as she heads for the booth.  18.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Hey, maybe after you're done we could grab some coffee or --

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Actually...I'm kind of busy tonight. Andre shoots Dave a sly, triumphant grin. Dave nods to Becky, walks out shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Transducers. Way. to go, Dave.

dialogues.speaker: RICH WOMAN, (PRELAP)
dialogues.text: Is the crowbar really necessary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In an art-filled penthouse, the RICH COUPLE from the auct look on as a sweating, out-of-breath DOORMAN wedges a cro under the urn's lid. The couple is dressed for a night ou

dialogues.speaker: DOORMAN
dialogues.text: Ma'am, I've been working on this lid for an hour. If you want this thing open... The woman looks to her husband, who taps his watch impatiently. She turns back to the doorman.

dialogues.speaker: RICH WOMAN
dialogues.text: Lock the door when you leave, George. And please...try not to scratch the enamel.

dialogues.speaker: DOORMAN
dialogues.text: I don't think a blowtorch could hurt this old pot, ma'am. The couple exits, shutting the door behind them. The door strains mightily, puts his considerable weight on the bar

dialogues.text: Where's the doll?

dialogues.text: Please don't hurt me! Balthazar shakes his head. Horvath's ring hand is coming forward, its SKULL EYES glowing forebodingly.

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: All right, get on the eagle.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: But I --

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: Get on the eagle, Dave!

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I'm scared of flying!

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: New rule, Dave. From here on out you're scared of one thing and one thing only. Me: Now get up here!!! Dave looks back at Horvath, sees the murder in his eyes.

Balthazar shakes his head, grabs Dave and hoists him up b the seat of his pants. And with that, the eagle takes to sky, disappearing into the LOW CLOUDS...

The eagle circles the CHRYSLER BUILDING, touches down on former perch. As Balthazar and Dave climb off onto the parapet, Balthazar touches the eagle as if to say thanks. A gleam in the great bird's eye, then once again it's a LIFELESS GARGOYLE.

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: A man named Denethor Maltwood first brought this eagle to life in 1928. It's helped more than one sorcerer get across town in a hurry. (off Dave's awe) This city is full of magic, if you know where to look. . Dave looks out on the lights of New York as if seeing the city for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: Horvath must've put a tracking spell on you, that day in my shop. Balthazar splays his hands, his GREEN DIAMOND RING taking a strange glow. Balthazar sees Dave staring at his ring.

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: A sorcerer's ring is a conduit for his magic, but it also possesses a magic of its own. Getting a hold of your ring would make Horvath that much stronger. A SHIMMERING AURA washes over Dave, then disappears.

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: Cloaking spell. It'll throw him off our trail. Dave shakes his head, can't believe this is happening...a  26.

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: Look, I know you were shocked to see me back there. How ‘bout I give you another chance to show me what you got? Doesn't need to be fancy. Some levitation, a little stormcasting --

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Look, I don't know who you think I am --

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: Don't want to show off, huh? Okay, how about -- block this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balthazar sends a CONCUSSION BLAST flying in on Dave -- WHOOM!!! Dave goes sailing into a low wall and crumples. Balthazar can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me?! What have you been doing for the last ten years?!

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: (trying to breathe) +--I'm okay...

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: Didn't you read the book I gave you?! Dave gets to his feet, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I left it in the shop. (off Balthazar's glare) You know, in the confusion.

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: Oh, absolutely, Dave! I'm sure the situation was very confusing!!!

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Well, I don't think sarcasm is really called for! I was ten years old, I was freaking out! I'm still freaking out! Maybe it would help if you told me WHAT THE HELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balthazar shakes his head, reaches into his coat.  bets. 27.

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: Pay attention, there will be a quiz later. (off Dave's look) No, seriously, there will be. Balthazar throws a handful of BLUE DUST that ignites the with a VOOSHHH!

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: There are two kinds of sorcerers in the world. You and I are Merlineans. We can trace our lineage from sorcerer to apprentice, all the way back to Merlin Ambrosius... The ignited dust lingers in the air like a nebula, assume the shape of MERLIN, ancient and wise in a druidic robe.

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: Then there's the Morganians... A flick of RED DUST sparks another explosion -- and a spe image of the treacherously beautiful MORGANA LE FAY.

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: +-.their line runs back to Morgana le Fay, an evil sorceress who was King Arthur's half-sister and Merlin's arch-enemy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But -- that stuff's just a myth.

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: You just rode into town on a gargoyle, Dave. Think it's time to put the ol' skepticism in check? (continuing) Now, every sorcerer has a duty to pass his knowledge on to his apprentice before he dies. Our pal Horvath back there was apprenticed to my old Master, a Merlinean by the name of Aurelius Flood. A SEPULCHRAL IMAGE flits across the facade of the Chrysle tower -- AURELIUS FLOOD is an old man in a Victorian over We've seen that face before: the photos in Balthazar's sh  28.

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: But Horvath turned traitor, joined a group of Morganians who wiped out almost every living Merlinean. They killed Aurelius while trying to steal an artifact of unspeakable power: the Grimhold.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: That nesting doll...but what's inside?

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: An evil so powerful, it's all Horvath needs to kill the last two Merlineans on the face of the Earth.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: (re: the two of them) You mean...?

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: For eons we kept the Morganians in check. Now it's just you and me -- and if we don't find that doll before Horvath does, a world where the vilest kind of sorcery has free reign over mankind. Unfortunately, your training's gonna be kind of an on-the-job deal --

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, "training?" Look, I've got a life. I'm trying to graduate!

dialogues.text: "Graduate?" Excuse. me, did you hear a word I just said?!

dialogues.text: I'm not a sorcerer, okay?!

dialogues.text: Maxim Horvath thinks you are. And I'm sorry, Dave, but that's ail that matters. I'm looking at a dead man. Dave swallows hard.

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: So, you have two choices. You can go back to your life and have the highest GPA in the morgue. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR, (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: This is crazy. . You see that, right?! You see how crazy this is?! Balthazar shakes his head, smiles.

dialogues.text: So you turned your back on love and sorcery, and buried yourself in those books of yours.

dialogues.text: My project's on --

dialogues.text: (surprised) Yeah...how'd you know? Balthazar turns around, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: Lucky guess.

dialogues.text: Balthazar digs through his various pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The OLD CHINESE WOMAN we saw in the Astral Projection tur around as the shop door opens.

dialogues.text: We'll have to wait.

dialogues.text: I thought the fate of the world is at stake. Can't you just use your powers to --

dialogues.text: Commit breaking and entering?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: No -- well, not exactly. Justa little spell on the doorknob, just a little...you_know.

dialogues.speaker: BALTHAZAR
dialogues.text: Good. Now come on, I haven't eaten since the Clinton Administration. MOMENTS LATER -- Dave and Balthazar lean against a buildi eating from take-out cartons.

dialogues.text: So is sorcery science, or magic?

dialogues.text: Try this. It's delicious.

dialogues.text: Are you insane?

dialogues.text: It's not hot. Seriously, you don't know what you're missing.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: That thing'1ll eat through my intestines.

dialogues.text: I'm telling you, these aren't hot! (then) Aurelius had a saying: "Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage." Well, let me tell you, from where I'm standing, you've got yourself a little shrinkage problem. Dave looks down.

dialogues.text: Too scared to tell Becky how you feel --

dialogues.text: -- too scared to believe in something you can't reduce to an equation. dialogues.text: Wow, that was insane... Balthazar starts to walk off when Dave spins him around, throws his best punch. Balthazar catches it, smiles.

dialogues.text: Now that's more like it. Balthazar walks off. Dave realizes he's just been tested, and passed.

dialogues.text: (turns to Balthazar) What's he talking about? But Balthazar's eyes are locked on Menmet-Ra.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
